name: HIVE
comment: This is comment for HIVE service

properties.name: hive.metastore.local
properties.description:
controls whether to connect to remove metastore server or
    open a new metastore server in Hive Client JVM

properties.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionDriverName
properties.description: Driver class name for a JDBC metastore

properties.name: hive.metastore.warehouse.dir
properties.description: location of default database for the warehouse

properties.name: hive.metastore.cache.pinobjtypes
properties.description: List of comma separated metastore object types that should be pinned in the cache

properties.name: hadoop.clientside.fs.operations
properties.description: FS operations are owned by client

properties.name: hive.metastore.client.socket.timeout
properties.description: MetaStore Client socket timeout in seconds

properties.name: hive.metastore.execute.setugi
properties.description: In unsecure mode, setting this property to true will cause the metastore to execute DFS operations using the client's reported user and group permissions. Note that this property must be set on both the client and     server sides. Further note that its best effort. If client sets its to true and server sets it to false, client setting will be ignored.

properties.name: hive.security.authorization.enabled
properties.description: enable or disable the hive client authorization

properties.name: hive.security.authorization.manager
properties.description:
the hive client authorization manager class name.
    The user defined authorization class should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.HiveAuthorizationProvider.
